trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for iOS apps
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for iOS apps

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for iOS development.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for iOS development.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple _To do list_ app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service uses .NET and Visual Studio for server-side business logic.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service uses .NET and Visual Studio for server-side business logic.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service with server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version] of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service with server-side business logic in JavaScript, see the [JavaScript backend version] of this topic.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get [free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/mobile-services/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get [free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/mobile-services/).

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-dotnet-backend-ios-get-started%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=AE564AB28&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fmobile-services-dotnet-backend-ios-get-started%2F).

trans-unit.source: Create a new mobile service
trans-unit.target: Create a new mobile service

trans-unit.source: Download the mobile service and app to your local computer
trans-unit.target: Download the mobile service and app to your local computer

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created the mobile service, download projects that you can run locally.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created the mobile service, download projects that you can run locally.

trans-unit.source: Click the mobile service that you just created, then in the Quick Start tab, click **iOS** under **Choose a platform** and expand **Create a new iOS app**.
trans-unit.target: Click the mobile service that you just created, then in the Quick Start tab, click **iOS** under **Choose a platform** and expand **Create a new iOS app**.

trans-unit.source: On your Windows PC, click **Download** under **Download and publish your service to the cloud**.
trans-unit.target: On your Windows PC, click **Download** under **Download and publish your service to the cloud**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the Visual Studio project that implements your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the Visual Studio project that implements your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.

trans-unit.source: On your Mac, click **Download** under **Download and run your app**.
trans-unit.target: On your Mac, click **Download** under **Download and run your app**.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service, along with the Mobile Services iOS SDK.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample _To do list_ application that is connected to your mobile service, along with the Mobile Services iOS SDK.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.

trans-unit.source: Test the mobile service
trans-unit.target: Test the mobile service

trans-unit.source: Publish your mobile service
trans-unit.target: Publish your mobile service

trans-unit.source: Run your new iOS app
trans-unit.target: Run your new iOS app

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: This shows how to run your new client app against the mobile service running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This shows how to run your new client app against the mobile service running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Before you can test the iOS app with the mobile service running on a local computer, you must configure the Web server and firewall to allow access from your iOS development computer.
trans-unit.target: Before you can test the iOS app with the mobile service running on a local computer, you must configure the Web server and firewall to allow access from your iOS development computer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Configure the local web server to allow connections to a local mobile service](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-how-to-configure-iis-express.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Configure the local web server to allow connections to a local mobile service](mobile-services-dotnet-backend-how-to-configure-iis-express.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.target: [Add mobile services to an existing app]

trans-unit.source: Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: [Get started with offline data sync]
trans-unit.target: [Get started with offline data sync]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use offline data sync to make your app responsive and robust.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use offline data sync to make your app responsive and robust.

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to an existing app]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to an existing app]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: [Add push notifications to an existing app]
trans-unit.target: [Add push notifications to an existing app]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.

trans-unit.target: [Troubleshoot Mobile Services .NET backend]

trans-unit.target: Learn how to diagnose and fix issues that can arise with a Mobile Services .NET backend.
